order_id_schema.label: OrderId Schema
order_id_schema.comment: Here you can set a schema for the orderId parameter transmitted to identify the payment. If left empty it is not transmitted. The following placeholders can be used: {oid} for the order id, which may not be unique or set; {tid} for the sellxed transaction id which is a unique number, or {id} which contains the order id and is guaranteed to be unique.

payment_reference_schema.label: PaymentReference Schema
payment_reference_schema.comment: Here you can set a schema for the paymentReference parameter transmitted to identify the payment. If left empty it is not transmitted. The following placeholders can be used: {oid} for the order id, which may not be unique or set; {tid} for the sellxed transaction id which is a unique number, or {id} which contains the order id and is guaranteed to be unique.

invoice_id_schema.label: InvoiceID Schema
invoice_id_schema.comment: Here you can set a schema for the invoiceId parameter transmitted to identify the payment. If left empty it is not transmitted. The following placeholders can be used: {oid} for the order id, which may not be unique or set; {tid} for the sellxed transaction id which is a unique number, or {id} which contains the order id and is guaranteed to be unique.

cancel_existing_orders.label: Cancel pending orders when out of stock
cancel_existing_orders.comment: If a product is in stock only once and the payment of the customer ordering this product fails or is aborted, it won't be available until the order is canceled (see timeout option below). Enable this setting to cancel the customer's pending orders when he returns to the cart page and a product is not available anymore. Be careful though: If you enable this option, there is a chance that payments are made with the corresponding order being already canceled.

cancel_pending_orders.label: Timeout for pending orders
cancel_pending_orders.comment: Define the number of seconds after which orders with a pending payment will be cancelled automatically.

wait_for_success.label: Wait On Success Page
wait_for_success.comment: In some cases the transaction requires a few seconds until it is successfully authorized. When this option is enabled the user is hold until the transaction reach the final state. If this is not the case in 30 seconds a message is shown to the customer, which explains the situation.

logging_level.label: Logging Level
logging_level.comment: Messages of this or a higher level will be logged.

recurring.label: Recurring Payments
recurring.comment: If you would like to use recurring payments, you need our magento module "Customweb Subscription". For further information go to sellxed.com.

settlement.comment: Choose settlement after order in case you want an invoice to be created with your oder. The state of the invoice will set according to your capture status

invoice_send_email.label: Send invoice email
invoice_send_email.comment: Send the invoice email automatically after invoice creation.

status_authorized.label: Authorized Status
status_authorized.comment: This status is set, when the payment was successfull and it is authorized.

status_uncertain.label: Uncertain Status
status_uncertain.comment: You can specify the order status for new orders that have an uncertain authorisation status.

status_captured.label: Captured Status
status_captured.comment: You can specify the order status for orders that are captured either directly after the order or manually in the backend.

placeholder_size.label: Element Size
placeholder_size.comment: How should elements from Unzer be loaded? With narrow elements the element label is displayed by the store, with wide elements it is loaded via javascript by Unzer. The input elements are always loaded from Unzer.

send_basket.label: Send Basket
send_basket.comment: Should the invoice items be transmitted to Unzer? This slightly increases the processing time due to an additional request, and may cause issues for certain quantity / price combinations.

send_customer.label: Send Customer
send_customer.comment: Should customer data be transmitted to Unzer? This slightly increases the processing time due to an additional request, but may allow e.g. saving the payment method to the customer.

authorizationMethod.label: Authorization Method
authorizationMethod.comment: Select the authorization method to use for processing this payment method.
